intro: Cryptantha seorsa, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the flowers are usually pale blue or purple in color. Cryptantha seorsa plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native range.
